data.name: LblAutoFocusExposureTimeTooltip
data.value: Belichtingstijd gebruikt voor automatisch focus wanneer geen filter specifieke tijd is ingesteld of de specifieke tijd nul is

data.name: LblAutoFocusGearNotConnected
data.value: Kan Autofocus niet starten. Camera of focuser is niet verbonden!

data.name: LblAutoFocusInnerCropRatioTooltip
data.value: Indien ingesteld op een waarde minder dan één, sterdetectie tijdens autofocus zal alleen een gecentraliseerde subframe van de totale sensor gebruiken (indien ondersteund door camera). Indien dit niet wordt ondersteund door de camera, zullen sterren bij de rand genegeerd worden tijdens de sterdetectie. Indien gebruikt in combinatie met een waarde lager dan 1 zal een rechthoekig gedeelte van de afbeelding (tussen de binnenste rechthoek en de buitenste rechthoek) worden gebruikt voor autofocus.

data.name: LblAutoFocusMethodTooltip
data.value: Wanneer ster HFR is geselecteerd, zal NINA sterren in de FOV, hun HFR berekenen op meerdere focuspunten, en de minimale HFR vinden. De contrastdetectiemethode gebruikt beeldverwerkingstechnieken om een contrast over meerdere richtpunten te bepalen en vindt het hoogste contrast. Deze methode werkt ook voor aardse objecten of objecten in het zonnestelsel maar kan gevoelig zijn voor ruis.

data.name: LblAutoFocusNewWorseThanOriginal

data.name: LblAutoFocusNotEnoughtSpreadedPoints

data.name: LblAutoFocusNumberOfAttemptsTooltip
data.value: Als autofocus faalt omdat HFR slechter was dan het oorspronkelijke focus, hoeveel keer moet er dan opnieuw geprobeerd worden om te komen tot een succesvolle autofocus routine totdat er teruggekeerd wordt naar de oorspronkelijke focuspositie.

data.name: LblAutoFocusNumberOfFramesPerPointTooltip
data.value: Hoeveel frames je moet nemen voor elk focuspunt. Indien groter dan één zullen er meerdere opnames worden genomen voor een focuspunt en het gemiddelde van hun HFR zal worden gebruikt om de focuspunt te berekenen

data.name: LblAutoStretchFactorTooltip
data.value: De factor voor het autostretch algoritme dat wordt gebruikt om een afbeelding te tonen en sterren te detecteren. Moet een waarde zijn tussen 0 en 1. Een waarde van 0,2 zou het merendeel van de tijd moeten werken.

data.name: LblAzimuthMeasurementButtonTooltip
data.value: Meet azimuth fout in drie stappen. 1. Maakt een opname en platesolves voor actuele coördinaten van de huidige positie 2. Zwenkt telescoop gebruik makend van de sscensie-as met 0,5 graden 3. Neem een andere opname op de nieuwe positie, platesolves voor de actuele positie. Gebruikmakend van deze twee punten wordt de werkelijke azimuthfout berekend en weergegeven

data.name: LblDARVSlewDescription
data.value: Specificeer de duur van de D.A.R.V. procedure. De telescoop zal de helft van de tijd in één richting zwenken op de RA-as en vervolgens terug zwenken. Wanneer er geen sprake is van een polair-uitlijningsfout wordt het weergegeven als een rechte lijn. Anders een V-vormige lijn. Voor azimuth foutmeting zwenk de telescoop in de buurt van meridiaan, anders oost of west.

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorDescription
data.value: This tool will suggest a recommended exposure time based on the read noise from your sensor and the average skyglow. If you have SharpCap installed and perform a Sensor Analysis, then use the drop down below to retrieve the read noise and full well capacity for the specified gain. You can also calculate the bias by clicking the Snapshot button next to Bias Mean.

data.name: LblExposureCalculatorMeanLessThanOffset
data.value: Unable to determine exposure time recommendation. The mean of your current image is less than the specified bias mean. Please take a longer exposure or adjust the incorrect values.

data.name: LblFileCameraDescription
data.value: Deze gesimuleerde camera schakelt het gebruik van camera's die geen SDK hebben, terwijl de hele NINA workflow toch wordt gebruikt. Deze gesimuleerde camera zal de opgegeven map voor nieuwe bestanden bekijken. Deze bestanden worden opgeslagen in een interne wachtrij. Elke keer dat de applicatie een foto van de camera wil downloaden, wordt het eerste item van deze wachtrij geladen in N.I.N.A. Daarnaast kan een handmatige Bulb instelling worden geactiveerd zodat de geselecteerde Bulb instelling wordt gebruikt in Instellingen->Uitrusting,>Camera bij start. Wanneer deze instelling is gedeactiveerd zal de applicatie de Start Belichting overslaan en wacht gewoon tot een ander bestand in de opgegeven map verschijnt

data.name: LblAbsolute
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method to add an absolute value after a focuser direction change

data.name: LblFocuserBacklashMethodTooltip
data.value:
This controls the backlash compensation method used.
Absolute: When the focuser changes directions, an absolute value will be added to the focuser movement. Backlash IN: when the focuser changes from moving outwards to moving inwards the Backlash IN value will be added Backlash OUT: when the focuser changes from moving inwards to moving outwards the Backlash OUT value will be added
Overshoot: This method will compensate for Backlash by overshooting the target position by a large amount and then moving the focuser back to the initially requested position. Due to this compensation the last movement of the focuser will always be in the same direction (either always inwards or always outwards) For Backlash IN and OUT only ONE of these two must be set! When setting IN, the amount will be applied on each inward movement, so the final movement will always be outwards. For Backlash OUT, it will be the other way around.
The method can only be changed when the focuser is not connected!

data.name: LblOvershoot
data.comment: Focuser Backlash Compensation Method by overshooting the position and moving back

A positive number indicates the center of axis is higher than the base of the dome, and a negative number means it is lower.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddCondition_Tooltip
data.value: Add a loop condition to the instruction set. An instruction set will be executed and repeated when one or more conditions are added to a container as long as these loop conditions are truthy. Once one of the loop conditions are not truthy anymore, the execution of the remaining instructions inside the set will be skipped. Furthermore loop conditions are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddInstruction_Tooltip
data.value: Add an instruction to the instruction set. An instruction is a single instruction or a set of instructions that will be executed, when they are valid. Instructions that are not valid (indicated by the red circled exclamation mark) will be skipped.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_AddTrigger_Tooltip
data.value: Add a trigger to the instruction set. Triggers are instructions, that are only executed when the specified parameters to execute them are met. Trigger parameters will be updated and evaluated after an instruction was completed. Furthermore triggers are valid for the current instruction set and each sub set inside the set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Delete_Tooltip

data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_MoveUp_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction set and all its content up by one position. If the position above it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position above it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved above the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceContainer_Reset_Tooltip

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_Delete_Tooltip

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveDown_Tooltip
data.value: Moves the instruction down by one position. If the position below it is an instruction set that is expanded, it will be moved inside the instruction set. If the position below it is an instruction set that is not currently expanded, it will be moved below the instruction set.

data.name: Lbl_SequenceItem_MoveUp_Tooltip

data.name: LblAutoFocusCorrelationCoefficientThresholdTooltip
data.value: The minimum R² (Coefficient of determination) value that the selected auto focus fitting has to fulfill for the auto focus run to be considered as successful. The value is in the range between 0-1. When set to 0, the threshold will not be considered. An autofocus run with an R² value above 0.9 can be considered as ideal. However a lower value can still achieve focus in semi ideal conditions. A good starting point for a threshold is a value of 0.8 - anything below that is a questionable fit.
data.comment: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coefficient_of_determination

data.name: LblAutoFocusCurveCorrelationCoefficientLow

data.comment: First parameter is actual R², second parameter is R² threshold

data.name: LblAutoFocusTrendCorrelationCoefficientLow
data.value: Auto Focus failed! R² (Coefficient of determination) for trendline fitting is below threshold. Left: {0} / {2}; Right: {1} / {2}
data.comment: First parameter is actual R² of left trend, second parameter is actual R² of right trend, third parameter is R² threshold

data.name: LblShutterSettingsWarning
data.value: NOTICE: These settings relate to the safety of your equipment. They must be set with careful consideration and with the familiarity you have with your specific setup. They govern only N.I.N.A.'s control of the equipment and are NOT in effect if N.I.N.A. is not running or is not connected to the equipment in question. Dome or roof safety mechanisms should always have a hardware backup and electrical interlocks to prevent any undesired shutter or roof movement. It is your responsibility to ensure that these settings do not conflict with your dome driver's settings.

data.name: LblHardwareAccelerationTooltip
data.value:
This will enable or disable hardware accelerated rendering of the application. In case you are having rendering issues, or the application is turning blank when using a remote software while there is no monitor attached disabling hardware acceleration might be beneficial. Keep in mind that disabling hardware acceleration might reduce overall application performance.
Changing the value will require an app restart to take affect.

data.name: LblAutomaticMountSyncTooltip
data.value: When enabled the application will send a sync command to the mount during platesolve & center operations. This should only be disabled when having a good pointing model that must not be altered in any way. When disabled the plate solve panel in imaging tab will also not show the sync toggle.
data.comment: The option tooltip to turn automatic sync of platesolving to the mount

data.name: LblAddFzExtensionTooltip
data.value: Adds an additional .fz extension to the file name of compressed FITS files. Example: filename.fits.fz

data.name: LblASCOMCreate32BitDataTooltip
data.value: When the feature is enabled, N.I.N.A. will generate image data with a 32-bit depth, enhancing the pixel value range. However, it's crucial to note that this process will require more memory, increase processing time, and use additional disk space for each exposure. Keep in mind that only XISF and FITS file formats can store image data in this 32-bit format. Additionally, it is essential that the ASCOM driver used also supports this 32-bit depth. If the driver does not support 32-bit depth, the increased file size resulting from this setting would only lead to wasted space without any improvement in image data.

data.name: LblUseCfitsioTooltip
data.value: When this feature is activated, the FITS files will be created using the CFITSIO library, which is an alternative to the program's default method of writing these files. This change enables additional functionalities, such as the ability to compress FITS files for reduced file size and the option to store data in a 32-bit format for improved data precision.
